Comment_Body: I have a few points for you to consider before I merge this.  1. The first line in your readme has html tags. Both Github and the spices website are expecting markdown instead. I'm not sure what will happen with that, but I don't expect it to look very good. 2. Line 19 of extension.js uses a synchronous call. In this case it probably isn't a huge issue, but it's always preferable to use synchronous calls where possible. 3. metadata.json contains the dangerous property, which should not be included here. It is automatically added by Cinnamon when you open the settings window, and it's purpose is to help users identify potential causes of freezes, etc. If you leave out that line, the extension settings will flag your extension as potentially dangerous because of the synchronous call mentioned above. 4. prefs.json could be eliminated by moving the entire object to extension.js and storing it as a global variable near the top of your file. This would have the added benefit of removing the need for the synchronous call mentioned in points 2 and 3. 5. settings-schema.json uses 'header' items which are deprecated. You should use 'section' instead. This was a change that was made for Cinnamon 3.2 and the online docs have not yet been updated to reflect that change. 6. Your commit message should contain the name or uuid of the extension (like you did in the pr title) so that we can keep the commit history clean and easy to read.
